medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Menarche at 12 years; regular menses until starting oral contraceptives at 20; irregular cycles developed after discontinuation at 25. Between ages 28-32, had unprotected intercourse but did not conceive. Testing with ovulation predictor kits showed no evidence of ovulation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Intermittent oligomenorrhea; history of infertility for 4 years; episodes of headaches and sinusitis; chronic knee, shoulder, and hand pain; and occasional numbness and tingling for approximately 13 years.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had high cholesterol and osteoporosis; father was obese with prostatic hypertrophy; maternal aunt had type 2 diabetes mellitus.
medical_history.social_history: Lives with husband and baby; works in academics; drinks alcohol rarely; does not smoke or use illicit drugs.
